locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the omnipresence of God through the imagery of Psalm 139, moving from the lack of human privacy to the geographical and existential reach of God's presence in heaven, hell, and the sea.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong. The preacher uses historical context (local deities vs. territorial sovereignty) and literary appreciation of the Hebrew poetry to ground the message.

illocutie.beschrijving: The force shifts from descriptive storytelling (Assertive) to a final, powerful assurance of God's presence (Commissive/Declarative).
voorbeelden: I now baptize it and ordain it.
He has promised never to leave me alone.
I can confidently say to you... he will not forsake you.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To comfort the hearer and instill a sense of security in God's inescapable grace.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The Spirit is mentioned in the text but not explicitly invoked as the agent of the sermon's effectiveness.

voorbeelden: Israel took its trek from Egypt to Canaan.
There is a crude scientism still aboard in the world.
The heart of the whole biblical revelation is that God has come.
Stretch your imagination.
You and I ought to first believe that.
Go out beyond the timberline of the spirit.
I wish that I could find a nicer word.
I always feel moved.
Thank goodness she did not know all that I was thinking.
He has promised never to leave me alone.
I will be with you always.
He will not forsake you, will not leave you.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High quality in the conclusion; the preacher moves from quoting God's promise to personally mediating it.

voorbeelden: I now baptize it and ordain it.
Today shalt thou be with me in paradise.
He'll carry you on... until your work is finished.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate. The preacher uses personal authority to 'baptize' a word, but the sacramental authority is most present in the final benediction-like assurance.

indicatoren: Long anecdotes about landladies and Doberman pinschers.
Extended historical description of Israel's view of local deities.
Critique of Russian cosmonauts and scientific inquiry.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is an observer of a lecture or a story for the first two-thirds of the sermon.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the hearer's specific 'hell' or 'heaven' earlier in the text.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' only happens in the final movement.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Very strong and direct in the final paragraphs.
voorbeelden: He will not leave you, not even then.
I can confidently say to you... he will not forsake you.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used for anecdotes and personal testimony ('I now baptize', 'I saw a gentleman').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Used to confront the audience ('confront your hearts') and finally to bless them.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Strongest in the final commissive section.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Used for the poet, Israel, Adam, cosmonauts, and 'people'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that feels like 'talking about' God's attributes.

actueel_present.gebruik: The final address to the 'ministry' of the hearers.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from Assertive (God is everywhere) to Declarative (God is in your hell) to Commissive (He will not leave you).
voorbeelden: If I make my bed in hell, God is there... He will not leave you.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent transition in the final third.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: He has promised never to leave me alone... fight on.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: While heavily constative in the beginning, the sermon successfully transitions into a performative event by the end, where the preacher speaks with the authority of a mandatory.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: He will not leave you, not even then.
sterke_punten.effect: Creates a sense of ultimate security.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The story about the landlady and the Doberman pinscher.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Distracts from the illocutionary force of the text.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon 'happens' in the final movement where the 'Everywhereness' becomes a 'Presence for you'.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher effectively 'hands over' the promise of Christ to the specific context of the hearers' future.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, especially through the quoted words of Jesus and the Psalmist.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, evident in the phrase 'I can confidently say to you'.
tekstueel_bewijs: He says to those that gathered around, 'Lo, I am with you always'.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low. The Spirit is a subject of the text but not the explicitly invoked power of the preaching act.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's heart.
tekstueel_bewijs: Whither shall I go from thy spirit?

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon aims to be a 'word to speak' that carries the hearer.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: High in the 'wings of the morning' section.
tekstueel_bewijs: I now baptize it and ordain it.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is verb-rich but heavily weighted toward past-tense narrative and third-person description. The shift to future-tense commissives at the end saves it from being a mere lecture.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The heart of the whole biblical revelation is that God has come.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In this moment, God comes to you in your lowest depth.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a fact about the Bible to a present-tense event.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Maintain the current strength of the ending.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much time spent on 'the poet' and 'Israel'.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interweave the 'you' earlier in the biblical exposition.
voorbeeldzinnen: When you make your bed in hell tonight, behold, He is there.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Keep the imperative 'believe' grounded in the commissive 'He will not leave you'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of how a sermon can start as a lecture but catch fire as a sacramental event through the use of commissive language.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's relationship with his landlady; SAT focuses on the preacher's act of 'ordaining' the word and 'promising' God's presence.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'wings of the morning' metaphor; SAT asks if that metaphor successfully performs the act of bringing God near.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is concentrated in the shift from 'God is everywhere' (Assertive) to 'He will not leave you' (Commissive).

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I now baptize it and ordain it.
He will not leave you, not even then.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: The sacramental peak of the sermon.

appendices.notities: The preacher's use of 'I' is often anecdotal, which risks subjectivism, but his use of 'He' (God) in the final section is purely performative.
